elements.name: filingOptionsInfo
elements.title:
You can file your application in different ways.
  1. You can print your application and bring it (or mail it) to the court registry to file.
  2. You can email your application to the court registry.
  3. You can submit your application to the court registry through E-Filing online system.
To file your documents in person, you will need:
  • a printer (or print service)
  • a copy of your existing orders or agreements (if applicable)
  • a copy of your exhibits (if applicable)
  • Photo ID (to have your affidavit sworn/affirmed)
To file your documents by email, you will need:
  • email address
  • scanned or electronic copy of your existing orders or agreements (if applicable)
  • scanned or electronic copy of your exhibits (if applicable)
  • scanner or phone with a camera (to scan the documents above)
To file your documents by electronic filing, you will need:
  • scanned or electronic copy of your existing orders or agreements (if applicable)
  • scanned or electronic copy of your exhibits (if applicable)
  • scanner or phone with a camera (to scan the documents above)
